dt: {bc}a blend of molasses, invert sugar, and corn syrup used as syrup
{bc}something (such as a tone of voice) heavily sweet and cloying
{bc}a medicinal compound formerly in wide use as a remedy against poison

et: Middle English {it}triacle{/it}, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}theriaca{/it}, from Greek {it}thēriakē{/it} antidote against a poisonous bite, from feminine of {it}thēriakos{/it} of a wild animal, from {it}thērion{/it} wild animal, diminutive of {it}thēr{/it} wild animal {ma}{mat|fierce|}{/ma}
shortdef: a blend of molasses, invert sugar, and corn syrup used as syrup —called also golden syrup
something (such as a tone of voice) heavily sweet and cloying
